docs.abstract: An initiative to reduce the use of e-cigarettes by teenagers led to compromise. Sales of most flavored pods popular with youth will be forbidden, but flavored liquid nicotine for open tank devices will be exempt.
docs.snippet: An initiative to reduce the use of e-cigarettes by teenagers led to compromise. Sales of most flavored pods popular with youth will be forbidden, but flavored liquid nicotine for open tank devices will be exempt.
docs.lead_paragraph: In September, President Trump, the first lady and two of his top health officials gathered in the Oval Office to announce they would take what Mr. Trump called “very, very strong” action against the fast-growing epidemic of teenage vaping: a ban on the sale of most flavored e-cigarettes.

headline.main: With Partial Flavor Ban, Trump Splits the Difference on Vaping
headline.print_headline: Balancing Act On Path to Ban Vaping Flavors

byline.original: By Abby Goodnough, Maggie Haberman and Sheila Kaplan

docs.abstract: In bronze, silver or aluminum, a statue is an idea made solid. Two inventive shows in New York reaffirm the power of art in three dimensions.
docs.snippet: In bronze, silver or aluminum, a statue is an idea made solid. Two inventive shows in New York reaffirm the power of art in three dimensions.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1846, back when critics were not yet afraid of rendering judgments, Charles Baudelaire went to the Paris Salon and wrote a review that aimed to put an entire art form out of business.

headline.main: In the Swim of Digital Images, There’s Nothing Boring About Sculpture
headline.print_headline: Now’s the Time to Stand Up for Sculpture

docs.abstract: Here are some strategies for a hard conversation.
docs.snippet: Here are some strategies for a hard conversation.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it Tuesdays and Thursdays.

headline.main: So You Want to Convince a Climate Change Skeptic

docs.abstract: The former Knick had 26 points and 7 rebounds, but his Trail Blazers fell.
docs.snippet: The former Knick had 26 points and 7 rebounds, but his Trail Blazers fell.
docs.lead_paragraph: Before Wednesday night’s game at Madison Square Garden, Carmelo Anthony found himself glancing up at the rafters. He was wondering whether his No. 7 would be up there someday. The Knicks will ultimately make that decision, he said. But he was hoping to nudge the process along.

headline.main: Carmelo Anthony Scores, and Loses, at the Garden. Sound Familiar?
headline.print_headline: Like Old Times: Anthony Scores, but Loses, at the Garden

docs.abstract: On a flat stretch of highway in Washington State, tumbleweeds were piled as high as 30 feet across an area three football fields long.
docs.snippet: On a flat stretch of highway in Washington State, tumbleweeds were piled as high as 30 feet across an area three football fields long.
docs.lead_paragraph: In ghost towns and gunslinger movies, they drift in ones or twos, cast wherever the wind takes them.

headline.main: Storm of Tumbleweeds Buries Cars, Terrifies Drivers and Astounds Police
headline.print_headline: 30-Foot Drift of Tumbleweeds Buries Motorists on the Highway

docs.abstract: His portrayal of Elton John was praised by critics and audiences alike, but the Oscar competition is formidable and memories in Hollywood are short.
docs.snippet: His portrayal of Elton John was praised by critics and audiences alike, but the Oscar competition is formidable and memories in Hollywood are short.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — No one delivered a gutsier film performance in 2019 than Taron Egerton.

headline.main: Taron Egerton Tries to Keep ‘Rocketman’ Performance in Orbit

docs.abstract: Mark Galli, who is retiring, was overwhelmed by the vocal criticism and quiet praise after his editorial in a prominent evangelical magazine called for President Trump’s ouster.
docs.snippet: Mark Galli, who is retiring, was overwhelmed by the vocal criticism and quiet praise after his editorial in a prominent evangelical magazine called for President Trump’s ouster.
docs.lead_paragraph: People have been upset with Mark Galli before. As the editor in chief of Christianity Today, a prominent evangelical magazine, he has printed some controversial editorials. But the people he irks usually do not include the IT department of his own publication.

headline.main: Christianity Today Editor Laments ‘Ethical Naïveté’ of Trump Backers
headline.print_headline: Editor of Christianity Today Laments ‘Ethical Naïveté’ of Trump Supporters

docs.abstract: The hotel workers’ union has become one of the most feared political forces in New York.
docs.snippet: The hotel workers’ union has become one of the most feared political forces in New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the presidential campaign of Mayor Bill de Blasio foundering from the start, desperation mode hit early. He needed money, support — anything that might prolong his chances.

headline.main: This Union Defeated Airbnb. Now It’s Taking Aim at a New Target.
headline.print_headline: Hotel Workers’ Union Morphs Into an Imposing Political Force

docs.abstract: To kick off 2020, we’ve compiled a month’s worth of free, family-friendly and otherwise noteworthy cultural events.
docs.snippet: To kick off 2020, we’ve compiled a month’s worth of free, family-friendly and otherwise noteworthy cultural events.
docs.lead_paragraph: The holidays are over. The new year is here. And there are a number of films series, plays and more to keep you entertained this month. Looking to chill out at home? Read Mike Hale’s guide to the TV shows you’ll want to watch this winter at nytimes.com/television. Looking for even more reasons to get out of the house? Visit our Arts & Entertainment Guide at nytimes.com/spotlight/arts-listings.

headline.print_headline: So Much to See, on Stages and Screens

docs.abstract: The soccer star returned to his hometown last summer, and to Italy’s Serie A. The city had changed. But so had he.
docs.snippet: The soccer star returned to his hometown last summer, and to Italy’s Serie A. The city had changed. But so had he.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRESCIA, Italy — No matter where his career has taken him, Mario Balotelli’s home has always been here, in an apartment block sandwiched between a Volvo dealership and the campus of the University of Brescia. The bottom floor is taken up by a bicycle shop, a piadina joint and an interiors showroom. Balotelli has the penthouse.
